request.description:
Login:

This enables already registered user's gain access and be able to work with the other routes or endpoint.

when user's provide the required credentials a token is generated and user's can make requests to secured endpoint.

Sample Generated Token:
{
    "token": "eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJodHRwOlwvXC9sb2NhbGhvc3Q6ODAwMFwvYXBpXC9sb2dpbiIsImlhdCI6MTY1NjI2MjQzNCwiZXhwIjoxNjU2MjY2MDM0LCJuYmYiOjE2NTYyNjI0MzQsImp0aSI6IlRvbUJmZVV3aVZnUzhNMXkiLCJzdWIiOjUsInBydiI6IjIzYmQ1Yzg5NDlmNjAwYWRiMzllNzAxYzQwMDg3MmRiN2E1OTc2ZjcifQ.fi551i9c3vbD4nDxXXQaGq3bBt0u-GNR01vehnIU8UI"
}

Sample Failed User Auth:

{
    "msg": "Invalid User"
}

Form Field:

1. email: // valid email required
2. password: // string data type

Note:
it is best practice to validate user data either in the frontend and or also in the backend but this was not covered here

Signup:

like the name implies this enable user's create an account and after get's signed in automatically.

Token's are generated after successful registration which can be stored on the user's computer.

Sample Response Success Response:

{
    "msg": "New User Created",
    "token": "eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJodHRwOlwvXC9sb2NhbGhvc3Q6ODAwMFwvYXBpXC9zaWdudXAiLCJpYXQiOjE2NTYyNzE5MzgsImV4cCI6MTY1NjI3NTUzOCwibmJmIjoxNjU2MjcxOTM4LCJqdGkiOiJMYTFUaTZPVkVDT3VsSzF2Iiwic3ViIjoxLCJwcnYiOiIyM2JkNWM4OTQ5ZjYwMGFkYjM5ZTcwMWM0MDA4NzJkYjdhNTk3NmY3In0.xVT86m23FOvITWt-mko9wk8ZXsSH-xXeZmPQ7vNV0PY"
}

Form Fields:

1. full_name: // string required
2. email: // string valid email required
3. password: // string required

Note:
it is best practice to validate user data either in the frontend and or also in the backend but this was not covered here

Create System:

This end point allows user's Create system requirements and other system information's.

only user's with the required token will be granted access

Sample Success Response:

{
    "msg": "New system created"
}



Form Fields:

1. system_uptime: // Date required 
2. total_ram: // Integer required
3. allocated_ram: // Integer required
4. total_disk: // Integer required
5. allocated_disk: // Integer required
6. pc_name: // String required

Note: it is best practice to validate user data either in the frontend and or also in the backend but this was not covered here

list_specific_system:

This end point returns specific user system information's and accepts a unique id.

only user's with the required token can make a request to this endpoint

Sample Returned Data:

{
    "id": 2,
    "user_id": 2,
    "system_uptime": "2020-06-06",
    "total_ram": 9,
    "allocated_ram": 8,
    "total_disk": 400,
    "allocated_disk": 1000,
    "created_at": "2022-06-26T18:36:57.000000Z",
    "updated_at": "2022-06-26T18:36:57.000000Z"
}



Form Fields:

1. id: // Integer required 

Note: it is best practice to validate user data either in the frontend and or also in the backend but this was not covered here

update_system:

This end point allows user's Update system system information's.

only user's with the required token will be granted access

Sample Success Response:

{
    "msg": "Data Updated"
}



Form Fields:

1. id: // Integer required 


Note: it is best practice to validate user data either in the frontend and or also in the backend but this was not covered here

delete_system:

This end point allows user's Delete system system information's.

only user's with the required token will be granted access

Sample Success Response:

{
    "msg": "Data Deleted"
}



Form Fields:

1. id: // Integer required 


Note: it is best practice to validate user data either in the frontend and or also in the backend but this was not covered here

list_all_sysytems:

This end list's all system system information's and supports pagination.


Sample Success Response:
{
    "current_page": 1,
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "user_id": 1,
            "system_uptime": "2020-06-06",
            "total_ram": 9,
            "allocated_ram": 8,
            "total_disk": 400,
            "allocated_disk": 1000,
